metadata.synopsis: A retired tai chi teacher leaves his native China and moves to New York City to live with his son.

reviews: Ang Lee's feature debut explores cross-cultural and generational conflicts, issues that would become the backbone of his work. This is the first in what can be described as Father Knows Best trilogy, tales about a parent confronting a changing world.
Depicts the difficulties a tai chi master has in adapting to the consumer culture of America.
